default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|type=martial weapon|source=phb} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon|source=phb}
(a) {@item chain mail|phb}, (b) {@item scale mail|phb} or (c) {@item leather armor|phb}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 bolts or (b) five {@item javelin|phb}s
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

entries: 一个身穿闪亮板甲的人类盯着一只咆哮的猫头鹰，慢慢地伸手去拿绑在她背上的长矛。在她拿到武器之前，猫头鹰就冲了过来，但天空中的一道火光让猫头鹰停下了脚步。金龙降落在人类面前，它的眼睛燃烧着炽热的复仇之火，它打着喷嚏，使火焰从它的鼻孔中喷出。人类骑上她的龙，在龙腾空而起时发出了战吼。
拉开弓弦，精灵低声说了几句，下面的地精周围爆发出一道弧形的火焰。闪电在他的箭尖上闪烁，他一边向地精首领射击，一边自嘲地笑着。箭找到了它的目标，地精首领几乎无法呼救，因为闪电从他的身体里爆发出来，向他附近的卫兵划去。在树上，一条附近的蓝龙自嘲地笑了笑，它向剩下的人走去。
铂金龙嗅了嗅一些碎石，然后点了点它，回头看向一个半身人。她走过来，他们一起移开了石头。半身人伸出手来，把躺在瓦砾中的小男孩的头发从眼睛上拂去。当半身人把他拉到她的怀里，把他带到安全的地方时，一个神圣的魔法盾牌包裹着他的小身板。
半兽人皱着眉头，在黑暗的山洞里寻找他的猎物。发出一声短哨，一条黑玛瑙色的龙似乎从阴影中出现，嘴里叼着一个死乌鸦。半兽人揉了揉眼睛，用手做了一个动作，龙吐出了乌鸦，它的爬行动物脸上露出了羞涩的表情，黑暗开始在这对夫妇周围旋转，使他们消失了。
虽然性格和战斗风格不同，但所有这些英雄都是龙骑士，一个与龙伙伴一起战斗的冠军。坚韧、无情、不屈，龙骑士和他们的龙从不放弃，为英雄或邪恶的目的而战。

entries.name: An Unbreakable Bond
entries: 骑士和他们的龙之间的联系几乎是不可能被削弱的。只有强大的魔法才能使他们彼此反目，他们几乎从不违背自己的意愿相互争斗。尽管如此，骑士和他们的龙还是会因为战略、战术，甚至是一些杂七杂八的事情而争论不休，因为龙尽管尊重它的骑士，但却不会很快放下它的自我。
随着骑士和龙的共同成长，这种纽带会得到加强，赋予骑士和龙令人印象深刻的力量和独特的能力。在发展过程中，龙通常是一对中比较强壮的，但在早期会比较弱，而骑士仍然要看管它们，以确保它们的关系能够继续发展。最终，一些骑士可能会放下武器，与他们的龙过着简单的生活，通过他们所面临的考验，建立起传奇般的友谊。
然而，这种联系也有其缺点，如果骑士在战斗中倒下，龙也会死去，因为龙的精神不能没有骑士的陪伴。如果龙在战斗中倒下，骑士可以通过昂贵的仪式来恢复它的身体，但有一些骑士可能会选择让他们的龙休息，而去简单地引导他们的龙的力量。

entries.name: Practice Makes Perfect
entries: 所有的龙骑士都是以他们的修行方式来划分的，就像他们养的龙和与之战斗的龙一样，骑士们最好的时候是以骄傲著称，最坏的时候是以自负著称。不同修行的两个人很少能够相处，尽管他们可能有多么相似。铂金修行者总是认为自己比影子修行者高明，而元素修行者认为骑士修行者是野蛮和愚笨的。
尽管有这些竞争，但龙骑士是非常忠诚的，他们永远不会背叛另一个龙骑士，即使他们来自不同的实践。龙骑士们相信他们只有彼此可以依靠，因为没有人理解骑士和龙之间的强烈联系。

entries.name: Creating A Dragon Knight
entries: 在创建你的龙骑士时，有一个问题你应该先考虑，你是怎么得到你的龙的？你是否找到了一个蛋，并设法与孵化的小龙形成了联系？它是一个古老的龙的礼物，正在寻找一个人保护它的孩子吗？它是否有一天宣布你是它的骑士，这让你很惊讶？
所有的龙骑士都要经历结合仪式，在这个仪式上，他们与他们的龙形成紧密的联系，建立彼此的盟友和保护者。你的龙在这个仪式中是自愿的，还是被养来为你服务的？或者你的龙实际上是在进行这个仪式，而你完全不知道发生了什么？
其他你必须考虑的是你的角色的武术能力。所有的龙骑士都擅长战斗，而你的角色如何也是需要考虑的问题。也许他们是军事学院的学生，或者是在家乡受训的警卫？

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: 按照这些建议，你可以很快地做出一个龙骑士。首先，根据你想使用的武器类型，将力量或灵巧作为你的最高能力得分。如果你打算专注于近战，你的下一个最高能力得分应该是体质，如果你想提高你的整体亚类特征，则应该是魅力。第二，选择民间英雄的背景。

entries.name: Covenant
entries: 每位龙骑士都有一个不同的故事，说到他们是如何遇到他们的龙的。龙和骑士第一次见面的方式往往决定了他们余生的互动方式，而糟糕的第一印象会对他们的关系造成灾难性的影响。
当你考虑建立这个盟约时，也要考虑以下问题：你和你的龙都是自愿的，你的角色是否曾为这个纽带感到后悔？

rows: 成年后与龙结合是你所知道的一切，也是你祖先一直以来的生活方式。
你在森林、山洞或海滩上偶然发现了你的龙。从那时起，它就没有停止过跟随你。
从你记事起，你的龙就一直和你在一起，而你不记得曾经进行过正式的仪式。
作为证明自己的方式，你到野外去捕捉一条龙，以证明你的力量和能力。
被迫与你的龙结合，它就像一个监护人和保护者，尽管你多么坚持你不需要它的帮助。
用大量的财宝换取了一颗龙蛋，你把龙养大，作为你的坐骑和伙伴。

entries.name: Relationship
entries: 龙和骑士之间关系的性质因每个龙骑士而异，并改变了每个骑士和龙之间的互动方式，以及他们周围的人。这种关系是基于他们的盟约、理想、缺陷和人格特征。
当你决定你的关系时，考虑它将如何影响你和你的龙一起战斗的方式。

rows: 最好的朋友甚至不能用来描述你和你的龙，你们绝对是一起做所有事情。
你的龙只是一个被利用的工具，而你喜欢经常提醒它这一点。
尽管你们有分歧和争吵，但你和你的龙已经开始尊重对方，但你们的关系仍然很不稳定。
你和你的龙都同意保持你们之间的业务关系。重要的是你们能如何帮助对方。
令你不快的是，你实际上是在为你的龙服务，而它在你们的关系中充当了领导者。
你和你的龙彼此憎恨，但由于你们之间的联系而被迫在一起。你们都明白分离会带来灾难。

entries.name: Obstacles
entries: 最后，拥有一个龙人的同伴并非没有麻烦。在你旅行的某个地方，你和你的同伴可能会在旅行者中引起恐惧，或者获得贵族法庭的愤怒。这个障碍可能会决定你的冒险中出现的复杂情况。
如果你选择从以下障碍物中滚动或选择，或创造你自己的障碍物，一定要考虑它如何影响你和你的龙与他人的互动。

rows: 你的龙同伴的母亲正在寻找它的孩子，你担心它可能会找到你。
赏金猎人正在寻找你的龙，因为它的鳞片和牙齿可以卖到相当高的价格。
一个村庄认为你的龙是他们所有问题的根源，并寻求报复。
由于你的纽带，你有轻微的龙人特征，使你看起来不值得信任和令人生畏。
一个宗教团体认为你是异教徒，因为你把龙放在你的控制之下，并想为他们自己的目的 "解放 "它。
你和你的龙曾经是一个完整的龙，突然的分裂是奇怪和不舒服的。

fluff.name: Dragon Knight

trait.name: Statblock Adjustments
entries: 你的龙伙伴获得以下额外的免疫力、速度和特性，这取决于你选择的龙的颜色。
龙获得对所列伤害类型的豁免权。绿龙也获得对中毒状态的免疫。
龙获得的爬行或游泳速度等于它的步行速度。
龙会获得它所列出的任何特征的好处。
{@b Amphibious.} 龙可以呼吸空气和水。
{@b Ice Walk.} 龙可以在冰面上移动和攀爬而不需要进行能力检查。此外，由冰或雪组成的困难地形也不需要花费它的额外移动。

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2})砍击伤害。

classFeature.name: Dragon Covenant
entries: 在1级时，你与某种类型的龙结成盟约。与每个龙相关的伤害类型被你以后获得的特性所使用。你还会获得一条龙的服务，龙的统计数据可以在文件的末尾找到。龙会获得额外的伤害免疫和特性，这取决于你为你的龙之盟约选择的龙的类型。
当你死亡时，你的龙也会在与你的龙骑士等级相等的小时后死亡。如果你的龙伙伴被杀了，你们之间的魔法联系可以让你让它复活。只要工作8小时，并按你的龙骑士等级花费价值25戈比的珍贵宝石，你就可以召唤出你同伴的灵魂，并使用你的魔法为它创造一个新的身体。即使你不拥有龙族同伴身体的任何部分，你也可以通过这种方式使其恢复生命。
让你的龙恢复生命是一个艰苦的过程，你必须消耗相当于你的龙骑士等级一半的命中率（四舍五入）来完成这个仪式。
最后，由于你和你的龙有共同的纽带，你可以说、读、写Draconic语。

classFeature.name: Companion's Bond
entries: 同样在1级时，你的龙会因为你们之间建立的联系而获得一些好处。
龙尽可能地服从你的命令。你的龙分享你的主动权，并在你的回合中采取行动。你决定它的行动、决定、态度，等等（不需要你的行动）。如果你丧失了能力，你的龙就会自行行动。如果你不在，它就自己掷出主动权。
你的龙不能采取攻击行动。它还没有掌握飞行技术，如果它在空中结束其回合，就会跌落。此外，它不能被用作坐骑，也不能与它抓捕过的生物一起飞行。
你的龙伙伴的能力和游戏数据部分由你的等级决定。你的龙使用你的熟练度奖励，而不是它自己的。在不穿护甲的情况下，你的龙伙伴的自然护甲等级为11+其体质修饰值+你的熟练度加成。
一级之后的每一个龙骑士等级，你的龙伙伴都会获得相当于6+其体质修正值的命中率，并获得一个额外的命中率。龙的命中率是D10，与它的大小无关。当龙的命中率降至0时，它可以像玩家一样进行死亡拯救。
你的龙伙伴也会获得你所选择的两个技能的熟练度，并分享你的救赎熟练度。你的龙族同伴不能适应或激活魔法物品。
你的龙族同伴的等级等于你的龙骑士等级，用于计算多态和真多态等法术。
你和你的龙总是知道彼此的方向，可以用模糊的图像、情绪和感觉进行交流，而不管彼此之间的距离有多远。
每当你获得能力得分提升的等级特征时，你的龙的能力也会提升。你的龙可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，也可以将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分，和平常一样，你的龙不能用这个特性将能力得分提高到20分以上。你的龙伙伴不能获得功勋。
你的龙与你保持一致，并有一个性格特征和一个缺陷，你可以从下面的表格中选择，或进行滚动。你的龙与你的理想相同，它的纽带永远是 "我会保护我的骑士；我会为我的骑士尽心尽力；我会为我的骑士而死。"

rows: 我喜欢收集宝石和艺术作品。
如果你威胁我的朋友，你就威胁到了我。
我保持警惕，以便其他人能够休息。
我喜欢探索，这样我就能发现和了解不同的文化。
作为一条龙，我自然比别人优越。
我对任何冒犯我的骑士的人抱有永久的怨恨。
当我的骑士与我以外的人相处时，我就会嫉妒。

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: 你采用一种特殊的战斗风格作为你的专长。从以下选项中选择一个。你不能多次选择相同的格斗风格，即使你可以再次选择。

classFeature.name: Dragon's Fury
entries: 在2级时，你的龙族同伴已经做好了战斗的准备，现在可以在战斗中采取攻击行动。
此外，你的龙获得了以下的攻击选项，它可以用攻击动作来使用。你的龙精通它们，并在它们的攻击和伤害卷中加入它的力量修饰。如果一个选项导致一个生物进行蓄力，蓄力DC等于8+你的熟练度加成+龙的力量修正值。你的龙可以使用这些攻击选项的次数与它的力量修饰值相等（最少一次）。

entries.name: Bite Attack
entries: 你的龙对它周围5英尺内的生物进行一次近战武器攻击。一旦命中，目标将受到1d6的穿刺伤害，以及额外的1d6伤害。这种额外伤害在6级时增加到2d6，10级时增加到3d6，14级时增加到4d6。额外伤害的类型与你的德拉科尼亚盟约相关的伤害相同。

entries.name: Tail Attack
entries: 龙对它周围5英尺内的生物进行一次近身武器攻击。一旦命中，目标将受到1d6的重击伤害，并且必须在力量救赎中成功，否则将被击倒在地。这个攻击的范围在6级时增加到10英尺，10级时增加到15英尺，14级时增加到20英尺。

entries.name: Wing Attack
entries: 你的龙可以拍打它的翅膀，而不是进行攻击。在你的龙的5英尺范围内，你选择的生物必须做一个力量救赎的动作。如果救赎失败，生物会被推到离龙5英尺的地方。在6级、10级和14级时，被推的范围和被推的距离都会增加5英尺。在做出这个特殊攻击后，你的龙可以立即移动到其飞行速度的一半。

classFeature.name: Dragon Knight Practice
entries: 所有的龙骑士都可以称自己为骑士修行、元素修行、白金修行或影子修行的成员。骑士修行的重点是与他们的龙同步工作：无论是在激烈的战斗中还是在战斗之外。元素修行者用魔法提高他们的战斗技巧，向他们的敌人释放毁灭。白金修行使用巴哈姆特的神圣魔法来支持他们的盟友，用他们的圣光保护他们。阴影修行者使用误导和欺骗来在所有情况下取得优势。
当你在3级时选择它，并在7级、10级、15级和18级时再次选择它，你的选择会赋予你特性。

classFeature.name: Eye For Detail
entries: 同样在3级时，你可以轻易地分辨出宝石、艺术品和魔法物品的价值和稀有性。你可以花1分钟来研究一个宝石或艺术品，之后你就会知道它的确切价值。此外，如果它是一颗宝石，你可以了解它是什么种类的宝石。如果它是一件艺术品，你可以了解它的年龄。
此外，你可以施展{@spell identify}的法术，但只能作为一种仪式。当你以这种方式施法时，你不需要材料成分。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到四级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。你不能用这个功能将一项能力得分提高到20分以上。
如果你的DM允许使用特技，你可以改用特技。

classFeature.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: 从5级开始，每当你在你的回合中采取攻击行动时，你可以攻击两次，而不是一次。
在11级时，当你在你的回合中错过一次武器攻击时，你的龙可以使用他们的反应来进行一次爪子攻击。

classFeature.name: Draconic Growth
entries: 同样在5级的时候，你的龙伴侣继续成长，并获得以下好处。

items: 在5级时，你的龙伙伴的飞行速度增加了15英尺，其他速度增加了10英尺，如果它在空中结束了它的回合，它不再掉到地上。在9级时，它的飞行速度和其他速度又分别增加了15英尺和10英尺。

classFeature.name: Rending Strikes
entries: 同样在5级的时候，你的龙伴侣继续成长，并获得以下好处。

items: 同样在5级时，你的龙的咬合、爪子和尾巴的攻击伤害增加到2d6。
此外，为了克服对非魔法攻击和伤害的抵抗和免疫，你的龙同伴的攻击也算作魔法攻击。

classFeature.name: Bite Damage (2d6)
entries: 你的龙的咬合攻击造成的额外元素伤害在10级时增加到2d6。

classFeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: 从6级开始，你的龙已经发展出从它的嘴里释放出原始的、毁灭性的元素的能力。呼吸武器的伤害，以及它的面积，由你的龙的颜色决定。
作为它的一个行动，龙可以呼出这种破坏性的能量。该区域内的每个生物在救赎失败时受到4d6的伤害，或在救赎成功时受到一半的伤害，救赎的计算方式如下。
线和锥的面积以及呼吸武器的伤害会随着你在这个等级中获得的等级而增加，如下所示。
一旦你的龙使用了这个能力，它就不能再这样做了，直到你完成一个短期或长期休息。

classFeature.name: Dragon Knight Practice
entries: 在7级时，你获得一个由你的龙骑士修炼所赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到8级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。你不能用这个功能将一项能力得分提高到20分以上。
如果你的DM允许使用特技，你可以改用特技。

classFeature.name: Draconic Advancement
entries: 在9级时，你的龙族同伴成熟了，使你们能更流畅地一起战斗。你的龙伴的体型现在变得很大，它可以被用作坐骑，并且能够和它抓捕过的生物一起飞行。此外，只要你的龙伙伴能看到你，它在所有的蓄力动作上都有优势。

classFeature.name: Bite Damage (3d6)
entries: 你的龙的咬合攻击造成的额外元素伤害在10级时增加到3d6。

classFeature.name: Dragon Knight Practice feature
entries: 在10级时，你获得一个由你的龙骑士实践所赋予的功能。

classFeature.name: Draconic Nature
entries: At 11th level, you take on the physical aspects of a dragon. You gain resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Covenant, and you gain one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Scales
entries: Scales cover sections of your body, helping shield you from harm. While you aren't wearing armour, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can still wield a shield and get this benefit.

entries.name: Eyes
entries: Your eyes become sharp and focused. You gain proficiency in the Perception and Investigation skills if you aren't already, and you have advantage on any (Wisdom) Perception or (Intelligence) Investigation checks based on sight.

entries.name: Tail
entries: Your spine extends and you grow a scaled, muscular tail. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can attempt to shove a creature within 10 feet of you as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用特技，你可以改用特技。

classFeature.name: Titanic Roar
entries: Starting at 13th level, your dragon can let loose a vicious roar, filling nearby creatures with dread.

As an action on its turn, your dragon can roar. Any number of creatures of your choice within 20 feet of the dragon must make a Wisdom saving throw against the dragon's breath weapon DC. On a failed save, creatures are frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
Once your dragon has used this ability, it can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Legacy of the Dragon
entries: At 14th level, you have been blessed with a dragon's extended lifespan. You age only one year for every ten years that pass, and can't be aged magically.

classFeature.name: Bite Damage (4d6)
entries: The extra elemental damage dealt by your dragon's bite attack increases to 4d6 at 14th level.

classFeature.name: Dragon Knight Practice feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragon Knight Practice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用特技，你可以改用特技。

classFeature.name: Ancient Resistance
entries: At 17th level, you can shrug off even the most dangerous effects. Whenever you or your dragon fail a saving throw, you can choose to turn that failure into a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Dragon Knight Practice feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragon Knight Practice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用特技，你可以改用特技。

classFeature.name: Fulfilled Covenant
entries: At 20th level, you and your dragon share hit points, the total of which is equal to your hit point maximum + your dragon's hit point maximum. Whenever one of you takes damage, that damage is subtracted from your combined hit point maximum. When this hit point maximum hits 0, both you and your dragon fall unconscious, but only you make death saving throws. If you become stable or die, so does your dragon. If you receive any healing, both you and your dragon return to consciousness. When you spend hit dice during a short rest, you can use both your hit dice and your dragon's hit dice to restore hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Rider Practice
entries: The bond between a dragon knight and their dragon is strong, but those of the Rider Practice take that even further. They seek to live and to die beside their dragon, a sentiment shared by the dragon itself. While not all riders mount their dragons, those who don't are rare. Those of the Rider Practice fight in tandem with their dragon, and win in tandem with them.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Claw
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you're able to better co-ordinate with your dragon. While both you and your dragon are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls that don't target you or your dragon.
Additionally, when a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to attempt to grapple or shove the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Eye
entries: At 3rd level, you and your dragon's keen understanding of each other allows you to better act in battle. You and your dragon can add your Charisma modifier to each of your initiative rolls.
Additionally, if you can see your dragon, creatures that it can see don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being hidden from you.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Scale
entries: Starting at 7th level, if your dragon is within 5 feet of you, it can protect you from a creature it can see as an action. Until the start of the dragon's next turn, the creature's attack rolls against you have disadvantage. If your dragon isn't within 5 feet of you, the effect ends.

Additionally, you can use an action to stabilize your dragon, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check. When stabilized this way, your dragon will regain 1 hit point after 1d4 minutes instead of 1d4 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Wing
entries: Starting at 10th level, you and your dragon rule the sky. Mounting and dismounting your dragon only costs 5 feet of movement instead of half your speed, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your dragon, and neither you or your dragon take fall damage if you fall 20 feet or less.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Fang
entries: Starting at 15th level, you and your dragon are able to tear through your enemies. If your dragon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a melee weapon attack in the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d6 damage.

Additionally, your dragon can use an action to rampage and make a claw attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of it, with a separate attack roll for each target. If you're within 5 feet of your dragon when they rampage, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against each creature within your reach that was attacked by your dragon during their rampage. Your dragon can't rampage again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Presence
entries: Starting at 18th level, the range of Titanic Roar is increased to 120 feet, creatures that are frightened of your dragon have a speed of 0, and when you or your dragon hit a creature that is frightened of your dragon with a weapon attack, the attack is considered a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Practice
entries: Dragon knights of the Elemental Practice value the raw, destructive power of their dragons, as well as their inherent charisma, and strive to both emulate and empower this aspect of their dragons through magic.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you heighten your battle ferocity with the ability to cast spells. See chapter 10 of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 of the Player's Handbook for the sorcerer spell list.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Elemental Practice Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spells level or higher. You regain all expended slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the first level spell chromatic orb and have a 1st-level and 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast chromatic orb using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice. Both must be from the enchantment and evocation spells on the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Elemental Spellcasting table shows when you can learn more sorcerer spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an enchantment and evocation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st of 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the sorcerer spells you know with another spell of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an evocation or enchantment spell.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since your magic draws from the power and dominance of dragons. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Weaponry
entries: At 3rd level, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can imbue your weapon with elemental power until the end of your next turn. When you make an attack with an imbued weapon and hit, the target takes extra damage of the type associated with your Draconic Covenant, in addition to he weapon's normal damage. The extra damage is 1d6 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d6 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d6.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Rush
entries: At 7th level, when you use your action to cast a spell, if your dragon companion can see you, it can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Fury
entries: At 10th level, When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die of the type associated with your Draconic Covenant, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Reach
entries: At 15th level, your elemental prowess extends outward. When you make an attack with an imbued weapon and hit, you can have up to two creatures within 10 feet of the target of the attack take half as much additional damage.

subclassFeature.name: Annihilating Breath
entries: At 18th level, when your dragon uses its Breath Weapon, you can empower it. It's area increases to a line 20 feet wide and 240 feet long if it's a line, or an 120-foot cone if it's a cone. Additionally, when you roll its damage, you can deal maximum damage instead of rolling. Finally, any damage your breath weapon deals ignores resistance to that damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Platinum Practice
entries: A few dragon knights worship the Platinum Dragon, Bahamut. These few are members of the Platinum Practice, and are dedicated to preserving the lives of their allies and the innocent.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Radiance
entries: At 3rd level, your draconic nature and that of your companion shifts to reflect the holy magic you now wield. The damage type associated with your Draconic Covenant becomes radiant, and any damage and condition immunities your dragon companion has are replaced with immunity to radiant damage.
Your dragon also physically shifts to reflect this change, and its scales change colour to look like the brightest platinum.

subclassFeature.name: Platinum Protector
entries: At 3rd level, as a bonus action on your turn, you can glow with divine power; you shed bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet for 1 minute.
Whenever you or another creature takes damage while in an area of bright light you shed, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by an amount equal to 1d6 + half your dragon knight level.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Light
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you now shed bright light in a 20 foot radius when you use your Platinum Protector feature. When you reach 15th level, the radius of the light increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Bastion
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you're able to easily stand against the tide of battle. You and your dragon have advantage on ability checks and saving throws to avoid being knocked prone, grappled, restrained, or otherwise moved against your will.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Covenant
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you reduce the damage a creature would take to 0 with your Platinum Protector, you can cause that creature to gain a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma modifier, which last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Platinum Ward
entries: At 18th level, you and your dragon embrace the true power of Bahamut, and his grace safeguards you both. You and your dragon companion gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, whenever you or your dragon take damage that would be equal to or lower than half your dragon knight level before resistances are applied, you instead take no damage.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Practice
entries: Dragon knights who revere necromancy, or even strive for vengeance, make up members of the Shadow Practice. Dark and elusive, these dragon knights use misdirection and guile to gain the upper hand in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Darkness
entries: At 3rd level, your draconic nature and that of your companion shift to reflect the influence of darkness you now wield. Your dragon's relevant damage type becomes necrotic, and any damage and condition immunities it has are replaced with immunity to necrotic damage.
Your dragon also physically shifts to reflect this change, and its scales change color to look like the darkest ebony.

subclassFeature.name: Creeping Shadows
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can move effortlessly across the battlefield, blending in with the shadows. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest. As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend a use of it to conjure a 10-foot radius sphere at a point you can see within 30 feet of you, which becomes lightly obscured with wisps of dark energy. This sphere lasts for 1 minute, and any bright light inside the sphere becomes dim light. While inside this sphere, you and your dragon can each spend 5 feet of movement to teleport to any unoccupied space also inside a sphere. You and your dragon can each only teleport this way once per turn.
When you summon this sphere, you can expend additional uses of this feature. Each additional use expended increases the radius of the sphere by an additional 10 feet.

You can't have more than one sphere conjured this way at a time. If you summon a second sphere using this feature, the first sphere vanishes. If you move further than 120 feet from the sphere, it vanishes.

subclassFeature.name: Withering Breath
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when a creature fails its saving throw against your dragon's Breath Weapon feature, it begins to wither for 1 minute. During that time, when it hits a creature with a weapon attack that use Strength, the damage of that attack is reduced by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Night Walker
entries: At 10th level, you and your dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action while in dim light or in darkness. You and your dragon also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks you make to hide in dim light and darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Shadows
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can have up to two spheres conjured by your Creeping Shadows feature at once. If you summon a 3rd sphere, a sphere of your choice vanishes.
Additionally, when you roll initative and have no uses of your Creeping Shadows, you regain 1 use.

subclassFeature.name: Umbra Pulse
entries: At 18th level, your dragon can create a vortex of swirling darkness around itself as an action on your turn. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of your dragon must make a Constitution saving throw, (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save, creatures take 10d10 necrotic damage and you can choose to have them either pulled up to 15 feet towards you or pushed up to 15 feet directly away from you. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half as much damage and aren't moved.
Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Practice
entries: Those of the Valiant Practice strive to lead their allies in battle. By weilding a magical banner to inspire valor and hope in their allies, these dragon knights are able to control and command the battlefield with their presence.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Banner
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you're able to empower others for battle, enhancing their skills and granting them strength. You can plant a banner in the ground within 5 feet of you as an action on your turn. The banner is incorporeal, can't be destroyed, and lasts for 1 minute. Once per turn whenever a friendly creature within 10 feet of the banner hits a creature with an attack or damages it with a spell, it can choose one creature damaged by that attack or spell and deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage to it. This additional damage is your relevant damage type.
Once you place this banner, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
The additional damage increases as you gain levels in this class, increasing to 1d6 at 7th level, 1d8 at 10th level, 1d10 at 15th level, and 1d12 at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Safeguard
entries: At 7th level, you can plant your banner as a bonus action on your turn, rather than an action.

Also, when your dragon uses it's breath weapon, it can choose any number of creatures it can see that are both in the area of it's breath weapon and within your banner's range. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the breath weapon, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

subclassFeature.name: War Front
entries: At 10th level, your banner affects creatures within 20 feet of it. At 18th level, this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Resolving Banner
entries: At 15th level, your banner enhances the abilities of your allies. When you plant your banner, choose an ability score. Whenever a friendly creature within your banner's range makes an ability check or saving throw using that ability score, they can roll a d4 and add the result to their roll.

subclassFeature.name: Steadfast Banner
entries: At 18th level, your banner can prevent all harm, for a brief moment. As an action on your turn, you can shield all friendly creatures within your banner's range. While a shielded creature remains within your banner's range, it is immune to all damage until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Garden Practice
entries: Some dragons wage war, and others hoard treasure. Few, however, learn to cultivate and nurture the earth, becoming one with it. Dragon knights of the Garden Practice live simple lives with their dragons, and only heed the call of adventure if something precious to them is at stake.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Flora
entries: At 3rd level, the draconic nature of your companion shifts to better reflect nature. Your dragon gains proficiency in the {@skill Nature} skill, and your dragon also no longer needs to eat or drink. Instead, it gains sustenance for staying on the ground for at least 4 hours a day. Finally, you and your dragon can cast {@spell druidcraft}.
Your dragon also physically shifts to reflect this change, and its scales change colour to look like vibrant leaves, with flowers that bloom throughout.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Magic
entries: Also at 3rd level, your dragon's plant like nature allows it to attune to the seasons, grantng the two of you benefits through the bond you share. When you finish a long rest, you choose one of the following seasons: Summer, Autumn, Winter, or Spring. Each season grants you benefits detailed in later features.

You gain access to the seasonal spells appropriate to the season you're attuned to. You can cast one of the seasonal spells you have access to once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You gain a second use of this feature at 5th level, and a third use at 11th level. Castng a 3rd or 4th level seasonal spell expends two uses of this feature. When you reach certain Dragon Knight levels, you gain new seasonal spells, as shown in each of the spell tables.

Finally, you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcastng ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when settng the saving throw DC for a seasonal spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Garden's Shield
entries: Startng at 3rd level, when you cast one of your seasonal spells using your Seasonal Magic feature, you or your dragon (your choice) gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Charisma modifier, which last for 1 hour.
The number of dice you roll increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 7th level ({@dice 2d4}), 13th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 19th level ({@dice 4d4}).

subclassFeature.name: Season's Greetings
entries: At 7th level, your dragon's breath weapon gains an additional benefit, depending on the season you're currently attuned to.

items.name: Summer.
items.entry: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's breath weapon have disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check they make before the end of their next turn.

items.name: Autumn.
items.entry: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's breath weapon are pushed 15 feet directly away from your dragon.

items.name: Winter.
items.entry: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's breath weapon have their movement speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Spring.
items.entry: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's breath weapon are charmed by your dragon until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Between the Seasons
entries: At 10th level, you can manipulate your magic to reach out into other seasons. As an action, you can cast any 1st level spell with a casting time of 1 action you would acquire from your Seasonal Magic without expending a use of the feature. The spell you cast doesn't need to be from the season you're currently attuned to.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Garden's Grace
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you expend both uses of your Seasonal Magic to cast a 3rd or 4th level seasonal spell, you and your dragon both gain temporary hit points equal to the amount rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Seasonal Magic
entries: At 18th level, when you cast a spell using your Seasonal Magic, your dragon use its reaction to make a claw attack.
